H0.text: A tropical plant that grows several feet high, with a large fleshy root that contains an acrid milk juice, poisonous in its natural form, produces from the juice, extracted under pressure and purified, a staple foodstuff called what. Tapioca

H1.text: A tropical plant that grows several feet high, with a large fleshy root that contains an acrid milk juice, poisonous in its natural form, produces from the juice, extracted under pressure and purified, a staple foodstuff called what. Yuca

H2.text: A tropical plant that grows several feet high, with a large fleshy root that contains an acrid milk juice, poisonous in its natural form, produces from the juice, extracted under pressure and purified, a staple foodstuff called what. Manioc

H3.text: A tropical plant that grows several feet high, with a large fleshy root that contains an acrid milk juice, poisonous in its natural form, produces from the juice, extracted under pressure and purified, a staple foodstuff called what. Casave

A4.text: Tapioca is a starch extracted from the tubers of the cassava plant (Manihot esculenta, also known as manioc).

A5.text: In Brazil's north and northeast, traditional community-based tapioca production is a byproduct of manioc flour production from cassava roots.
